polished_script:
HOOK: Your buyers aren't rejecting the house. They're rejecting you. [ON-SCREEN: BUYERS AREN'T REJECTING THE HOUSE]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: Carrie McCormick â€” top 1% luxury producer in Chicago â€” just told me the real reason deals die. And it has nothing to do with price, location, or market conditions. [ON-SCREEN: CARRIE MCCORMICK - TOP 1% CHICAGO LUXURY] You've been there: perfect showing, engaged buyers, then radio silence. You're blaming the market, the property, their financing. 
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what's actually happening that most agents never realize.

INSIGHT: Here's what Carrie said: "Buyers don't reject homes. They reject uncertainty." [ON-SCREEN: "BUYERS REJECT UNCERTAINTY" - CARRIE MCCORMICK] Here's how this plays out: Carrie's presenting a $2.1M listing. Buyer asks why it's priced there. [ON-SCREEN: $2.1M LISTING] Average agent says: "Market analysis supports it." Carrie says: "Two comps closed 90 days ago at $1.95M. Since then, inventory dropped 40% in this zip code. We priced at $2.1M because we're launching with a 72-hour social blitz, broker event Tuesday, and if we don't get action in 10 days, we adjust." [ON-SCREEN: CERTAINTY = CONFIDENCE] One agent gave doubt. One gave direction.

REFRAME: So when buyers ghost after showings, it's not the house. You gave them a price without a plan. You can fix this today by building certainty into every conversation.

CTA: "Do you give prices or do you give plans â€” which one?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: The real reason buyers walk away (it's not what you think) ðŸ‘†

HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #RealtorTips #LuxuryRealEstate #SalesStrategy #RealEstateAgent

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "Buyers don't reject homes. They reject uncertainty."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. Deliver hook with slower pace for impact â€” pause after "house" 
2. Speed up during Carrie's specific example to show contrast with typical agent response
3. Direct eye contact during reframe â€” this is the "aha moment"

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Replaced vague 'pricing as a narrative' with Carrie's actual $2.1M listing example showing exact comps, inventory data, and marketing timeline. Rewrote CTA from reflective 'ask yourself' to specific morning prep action: write three sentences, say them out loud before next presentation.
_metadata.judge_note: The hook promises a punch but the insight gets vagueâ€”show exactly what 'pricing as a narrative' looks like with a real example from Carrie's deals.
